text: A cold, windy evening in New England. Bare, looming trees line the sides of the desolate road. Suddenly, the darkne is broken by fast approaching LIGHTS. We see a speeding L Rover round a bend. INT. LAND ROVER - NIGHT. We pull in from the rear, revealing a mess of books and clothing including a distinctive BLACK PARKA. Driving the car is a cute, curly-haired, twenty year-old, MICHELLE MANCINI. She listens attentively to a “Lovelines” style t show on the radio.
You're listening to After Dark with Sasha on WVOP, the Voice of Pendelton University. Caller, you're on the air.
This is, um, Jane.
(sarcastic) Seems to be a run on “Janes” tonight. How can I help you?
Well, I’m having sexual thoughts about my roommate.
Is she aware of this?
No. I don’t think so. But, honestly Sasha, I'm not a lesbian.
Are you dating any guys? JANE. No.
Do you think about guys?
Um. Not really.
How many Indigo Girls albums do you own? (CONTINUED)
All of them.

Then Jane, I think it's time you wake up and smell the coffee over at Ellen’s house because you are way confused. Head immediately to the lesbian student lobby, make some new gal pals and once you've come to terms, see if roomie wouldn’t be up for a little Sapphic soul searching. Thank you, next caller. Michelle laughs, then pops a tape into the stereo. Bonnie Tyler’s 80's power ballad, “Total Eclipse of the Heart” starts BLASTING. Michelle sings along, not too convincing

Turn around/every now and then I get a little bit terrified and then I see the look in your eyes... The sunroof is open and the moon softly illuminates Miche She’s too entertained to notice a FLASHING LIGHT on the console...the low fuel gauge. She speeds past a large She station. INT. LAND ROVER ~ NIGHT. The car begins sputtering. She turns the radio down and notices the light and accompanying BEEPING.

(panicked) Oh no... : Through the windshield, she sees a rundown gas station in distance. MICHELLE (cont’d) Please...please make it. The car is on its last fume. It sputters into the station and dies. Michelle breathes a sigh of relief. A creepy, disheveled ATTENDANT steps out of his office and walks to car. Michelle opens the window just a crack.
(stuttering) R-r-ran out of g-g-g-gas? MICHELLE (cont’d) Yeah. Fill it up please. (CONTINUED)
She slips her credit card through the crack. He stares at her, nods and walks away. MICHELLE (cont‘d) (to herself) Freak show.
The gas hose is in the tank filling up. INT. LAND ROVER - NIGHT. Michelle looks at her watch impatiently.
M-m-m-miss? She turns to look. He’s calling out from his office door.
What?
C-c-can you p-p-please come here for a m- m-m-minute?
What is it?
Um. Credit c-c-c-ard company. They‘re on t-t-the phone.
Is there a problem?
They s-s-say they w-w-want to speak to you.

Hold on. She grabs mace spray and sticks it in her coat pocket. INT. OFFICE - NIGHT. It’s dark and dingy, the only light a dim, flickering fluorescent bulb. Michelle steps inside and the attendant immediately closes the door behind her, locking it witha key. (CONTINUED)
So where's the phone?

(nervously) M-m-m-iss...T-t-t-here- MICHELLE’S POV On the desk sits the phone...unplugged from the wall. She slowly begins to walk backwards towards the door. ATTENDANT (cont’d) S-s-s-ome- He goes to grab her shoulders.
Don’t touch me!
No...no! There's s-s-s- She reaches the door...it’s locked. He grabs her shoulder firmly and turns her to face him. ATTENDANT (cont'd) S-s-s-omeone --
She grabs the mace and fidgets around trying to remove th protective lock. ATTENDANT (cont'd) is-is-is -- She unlocks the mace, shoves it in front of his eyes and sprays. ATTENDANT (cont'd)

The attendant keels over. MICHELLE tries in vain to unlock the door. She turns arou and sees... THE ATTENDANT writhing in pain on the floor. ON THE DESK she spots the unplugged phone and grabs it. (CONTINUED)
She SMASHES the door window until there’s an opening big enough for her to fit through. Her gloves and coat protec her from the glass.
She's halfway out.
The attendant gets up. Her legs are dangling inside. He grabs them. She SCREAMS and starts kicking, hitting him i the groin. ATTENDANT (cont'd) (holding himself)

Michelle falls out and runs to her car. She's fumbling around with her keys when... THE ATTENDANT opens the office door. He's approaching. Sh can't find the right key. He’s almost there. Finally, she gets the key and leaps inside.
She starts the engine and looks around. He’s nowhere in sight, when -- EXT. GAS STATION - NIGHT. iL HE JUMPS in front of the car, shining menacingly in the headlights.
There’s S-s-some-!
Michelle hits the accelerator SMASHING into the attendant He's clinging onto the hood.
The gas hose flies out of the tank spilling gasoline all the ground. Michelle makes a sharp turn into the road and the attendant falls off. (CONTINUED)
He gets up and hobbles to the road trying to chase after car. It’s useless. He yells out and, finally, his words come out without a stutter.
She's already too far to hear his warning. As she sobs hysterically, she doesn’t notice...
the black parka we’d seen earlier begin to move slightly.
She presses “Play” on the tape player. “Total Eclipse of Heart” again. She sings along, trying to make herself fee better.
Turn around, bright eyes/every now and then I fall apart/Turn around, bright...
The FIGURE in the black parka rises. His face obscured by furry hood. He raises an ax and begins to inch towards Michelle.

Hanging from it is a blue and gold TASSEL with “96” pinne it. Michelle looks in the mirror. It’s completely black. She adjusts it and catches the reflection of the fur-trim parka hood. She turns around. HE’S RIGHT BEHIND HER Her eyes widen. The SONG is reaching its crescendo. “Turn around...every now and then I fall apart!”
The killer swings. With a squishy THUD, her head is slice and flies straight out the sunroof.  15 16
The head rolls over the top of the car, mouth agape, eyes widened in terror, and rolls RIGHT TOWARDS US until its m fills the entire screen.
A MOUTH, yawning.

Pull back to reveal NATALIE SIMON, a dark-haired, good looking twenty year-old staring straight ahead. Natalie's a serious type-A personality who'd probably fee more comfortable in a Donna Karan power suit than the gre goose down jacket she’s currently donning. She knows exac what she wants out of life and has no time to waste...her Runner is her bible.
I won’t encourage this.

A Gothic, stone building. Its windows boarded with wood a its front door locked with a heavy chain. The molding abo the front door clearly reads, “Stanley Hall.” : Next to her stands her friend BRENDA. She’s tall and athletic and blonde. Her carefree demeanor the antithesis Natalie. BRENDA . Cut me a little slack. I just transferred here this year. Now do I say Bloody Mary five or six times before I hear the spirits?
Brenda, give it up. You’re not exactly the midget lady from “Poltergeist.”
Are you scared Natalie? Natalie laughs.
(sarcastic) Right. (CONTINUED)
Brenda grabs Natalie by the arm and pulls her towards the dorm. NATALIE (cont'd) Here we go. Brenda stops in front of a window and peers in through a crack.
Bloody Mary -- Natalie rolls her eyes. BRENDA (cont’d) Bloody Mary. Bloody Mary. Bloody Mary. Brenda looks at Natalie. Takes a deep breath, and...
(okay, I’m over this) Bloody Mary. Suddenly, we hear what sound like far-off, tortured SCREA Brenda and Natalie look at one another. They’re nervous. The SCREAMS are getting louder and louder.
Come on. They start to back away when... A FIGURE appears behind them holding a light under his fa They turn around and SCREAM.
He LAUGHS hysterically. It’s Damon, goateed frat brother campus practical joker. DAMON (cont ’d) You called?
She was trying to summon the dead Damon, not frat boys with badly grown facial hair. Damon instinctively touches his goatee. (CONTINUED)
What do you mean? It took me a month to get this. Natalie smirks. He smiles at her flirtatiously. DAMON (cont’d) Anyway...it‘ll still tickle you in all the right spots.
Keep dreaming man-boy.
(angry) So is this what you do with your free time? Hang out in the rain by yourself waiting to scare people like a total freak?

Nah. Only when I see some idiot standing in front of the dorm trying to summon the dead. He points to the frat house behind them. DAMON (cont'd) I can see you through my window. Night girls. See ya in class tomorrow?
Unfortunately.

See ya. He walks away. Natalie puts her arm around Brenda. NATALIE (cont'd) Don’t tell me, tomorrow we're breaking out the Ouija board and getting fashion tips from Versace. Brenda shrugs her shoulders.
Not a bad idea. They look at each other and laugh.  17 10.

Small and cramped with posters of obscure college rock ba hanging on the walls. A window looks onto the engineering room where the ENGINEER sits, slouching over the controls We see a heavily made up, perfectly accessorized college standing with a wireless mike headset. This is SASHA, who voice we heard earlier. She commands the airwaves like a and sexy Dr. Ruth and becomes very animated as she speaks
(overmodulated)
Sasha turns around, snaps her finger at the engineer and. motions with her hand for him to lower the levels. He quickly obliges.
Yes I'm here.
(nervously) Um. Well...it’s kinda, um, embarrassing.
Spit it out Bijou.
That's the problem. I didn’t.
Oh. Getting a little extra protein in your diet, huh?
(breaking up) My stomach’s been killing me ever since. Sasha, I think I can feel them swimming around in there. Do I need to get my stomach pumped?

Bijou, I think the only thing you need pumped is the air out of your head. Swallowing is a major safe sex no-no. Now, sounds to me like there’s nothing wrong with your stomach that a shot of Pepto wouldn’t cure. Don’t stress and next time make sure to climb off that volcano before it erupts. Next caller.  18 ll.

The campus coffee shop. Over the radio, Sasha’s radio sho is PLAYING. Natalie and Brenda sit in couches next to a CRACKLING fireplace along with two guys, PARKER and PAUL. Notepads and textbooks fill the table in front of them. Natalie turns to PARKER, older than the others and wearin Sigma Epsilon sweatshirt. Parker has been at Pendelton fo seven years and has no intention on graduating just yet. bother dealing with real responsibility when you're the b known party guy on campus?
Parker, how exactly does Sasha come up with this stuff?
She devours every issue of Cosmo. Calls it her bible. BRENDA (cont'd) (anxious) So, finish the story.
Anyway, he was a professor on campus. Maybe twenty-five, thirty years ago.
What did he teach?
I don't know...biology or something. PAUL, the sexy and soft-spoken journalist, sits next to Brenda. He’s quiet and listens intently. The kind of guy who seems to be able to read you with one glance.
It was actually abnormal psychology from what I understand.

Not the point of the story, but fine, abnormal psych it is. Anyway, he flipped out one night. Went completely berserk. Grabbed his hunting knife and headed into Stanley Hall. Banged on every door. And every student that answered, he took that knife and slit their throats. Ear to ear. (CONTINUED)

18 He demonstrates it with a butter knife. PARKER (cont'd) Did away with an entire floor before stabbing himself straight through the heart. Again, he demonstrates with the butter knife. The group PARKER (cont‘d) UGGH...thus the annual Sigma Epsilon bash.
You have a frat party to commemorate a massacre?
(sarcastic) Any excuse to get plastered.
(grinning broadly) You betcha.
So Parker when this happened, you were, what, a sophomore here? laughs.
You can laugh but like I’ve said before, I really see no point in graduating before thirty.
What do you think Natalie? You buy it?
A massacre? Of course not. It’s a bullshit story you hear on every campus in the Northeast. Show me the proof.

Well, that’s the thing. Pendelton knew enrollment would suffer permanently, so, in cahoots with the national news media and various, other, powerful organizations...they’ve done their best to eliminate any information relating to it. (CONTINUED)
Yeah, I’m so sure. Suddenly there’s loud BEEPING. Paul checks his pager.
Just a sec. He stands up and brushes against Brenda. She eyes him longingly. Brenda turns to Natalie as he walks away.
Did you see how he brushed against my leg?
How?
Slowly. Like a seduction.
I say he’s into it.
I don‘t know. He’s good-looking, smart, straight. Not the type that usually goes for me.
Brenda, stop being so down on yourself. The leg brush...it’s a sign.
Should I ask him out?
Let him come to you.
Yo! Don’t mind including me in some of your chick banter. Paul walks back.
Something’s come up. -I gotta get to the newsroom.
Another e-coli crisis in the cafeteria? (CONTINUED)
I wish. That one almost got me the student Pulitzer. He winks at her, smiles and exits.
Bye!
Okay guys, I've got a scary story too. The group of lazy college kids who flunked out and ended up making blizzards at Dairy Queen. She opens up her book. Parker and Brenda GROAN in unison.
Natalie is fumbling with her keys. Suddenly, the door swi open taking Natalie aback. Holding the door is a wrinkled gray-haired JANITOR with a friendly demeanor.
There you go.
Natalie walks in.
Thanks so much.
(smiling) Oh no problem at all. Just finishing cleaning up. We catch a glimpse of the tiny computer room he’s cleanin

Well good night. He smiles at her and goes back into the room. INT. NATALIE’ S ROOM - NIGHT. 21 It’s dark inside. The door CREAKS open...Natalie entering She feels around the wall for the light switch. She hits as she-shuts the door. (CONTINUED)
(angry)

She‘turns to find TOSH, her gothic, manic-depressive room in bed with a guy. We see the room. Natalie’s half is neat and clean. The walls of Tosh’s half are painted black and Marilyn Manson posters hang from the wall. It’s a sty.
Sorry. She turns off the light. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. ‘ 22 Natalie lies in bed, looking away as Tosh and the guy MOA ecstasy. She grabs her pillow and covers her ears.

A large, auditorium style room. On the chalkboard it read “Intro to American Folklore.” The class is restless...no sign of the instructor. In the middle of the classroom si Natalie and Brenda. Behind them, Parker and Damon. Parker eating a bagel and a brown PAPER BAG sits on his desk. Da is staring at the overhead clock. It reads, “9:09.”
I'm telling you, it’s ten minutes.
Bud, I’ve been here six years. If the professor has tenure, which Wexler does, you wait twenty minutes. If not, ten’s the max.
(looking at clock) 5-4-3-2-1...outta here. He stands up. Just as he does, the door swings open. . PROFESSOR WEXLER, middle-aged and wearing an obvious toup walks in. He sees Damon.
Going somewhere Damon? (CONTINUED)
Me? No. Just stretching. He stretches his arms exaggeratedly and sits back down.

Good. Lights please. The eager TEACHER'S ASSISTANT hits the lights and turns o the slide machine. PROF. WEXLER (cont ’d) Last week we discussed folklore as a gauge for the values and concerns of the society that created them. Today we get more specific. The slide machine CLICKS to a spooky drawing of a darkene living room. In the background, a man in shadow is walkin down a staircase while a frightened and oblivious teenage girl sits on a couch, phone up to her ear. PROF. WEXLER (cont'd) A baby-sitter receives menacing phone calls and upon tracing them, realizes they're originating from the upstairs room. The room where she’s left the children under her care to sleep. Who's heard this before? Most of the class raises their hands.
That really happened to a girl in my old town.

(sarcastic) Yes, I’m sure it did. I’m sure most of you think this happened to girls in all of your hometowns. But it didn’t. The baby-sitter and the man upstairs is an urban legend, contemporary folklore passed on as a true story. There are variations of this tale dating back to the 60’s. All of them containing the same cultural admonition: young women, mind your children or harm will come your way. Damon leans over and whispers in Natalie’s ear. (CONTINUED)
— DAMON What's the chance that a better head rug will come his way? Natalie LAUGHS. Wexler turns around and sees her.
Something funny you’d like to share with us Natalie?
No Mr. Wexler. He stares at her hard.
Well then, why don’t you come down here and volunteer for my experiment.
Experiment?
Don't worry. You'll probably survive. Natalie takes a deep breath and stands up. She looks back ~ find Damon and Parker trying to conceal their laughter.
Wexler hands Natalie a packet of Pop Rocks.
Had these before?
Pop Rocks? Sure. They crackle in your mouth.
Eat some. She pours the candy into her mouth. It’s POPPING. : PROF. WEXLER (cont ’d) Thirsty? Wexler holds out a can of Coke. Natalie instinctively spi out. .
. Is there something you might have heard ~ about mixing pop rocks and coke? (CONTINUED)
Well, supposedly your stomach, intestines, everything...bursts.
Really? Anyone you know died this way?
Mikey. From the Life cereal commercial. You know, “Give it to Mikey. He’ll eat anything.” The slide machine CLICKS. A still of Mikey from the commercial appears.
You mean him.

Yeah. Another CLICK. A picture of a smiling, middle-aged man appears on screen. WEXLER (cont'd) What if I told you this is Mikey today. Alive and well and working as an ad executive in New York. Would you eat it then? Natalie looks around the class. All eyes on her.
I think I'll pass. Wexler looks disappointed. Suddenly Damon stands up.
I'll do it! Damon walks down and grabs the Pop Rocks. He swallows it down with a swig of Coke. He’s fine.

Again, nothing more than an urban legend. Suddenly, Damon falls to the floor. The class GASPS. He’s spasming uncontrollably as pop rocks drool down the side his mouth. Parker jumps up from his seat. (CONTINUED)

HE’S GONNA EXPLODE! Brenda SCREAMS and runs out of the room. BOOM! It sounds like something’s burst. The entire class stands and stare at Damon who suddenly jumps up and laughs hysterically. H pulls out the paper bag he was hiding under his coat. The class bursts into LAUGHTER. Wexler shakes his head an rolls his eyes. PROF. WEXLER (cont'd) All right children, shall we move on?
Natalie and Brenda step out from the classroom building.
You actually thought Damon was going to explode.
Well I didn’t want to take the chance of getting intestinal splatter on my outfit. They turn a corner and stop dead in their tracks.

A couple of police cars are parked in front of the studen union. Over by the newsstand, a crowd has gathered. BRENDA (cont'd) What's going on? Natalie shrugs her shoulders. As they walk towards the crowd, a passing GIRL drops a copy of the Pendelton Daily newspaper. Natalie picks it up. On the front page is a huge, New York Post style headline that reads, “IS THERE LUNATIC ON CAMPUS?" There’s a big picture of Michelle Mancini in the middle. NATALIE stares at the paper, shocked. . BRENDA (cont'd) (freaking ‘out) You’ve gotta be kidding me! I knew I should've gone to NYU.
(proud) Can you believe the trouble I’m causing? (CONTINUED)
They turn around and find Paul behind them.
Hi Paul... He smiles at her for a second before something catches hi eye over her shoulder.

The patrician, middle-aged college dean, ROGER ADAMS, is standing on the steps of the student union, clutching a c of the newspaper. Next to him is a young, black woman ina security uniform. This is REESE, campus head of security. She has a determined, intense look in her eyes. The Dean turns to a couple of young INTERNS and whispers them. They immediately walk down and through the crowd an begin confiscating the papers from the newstand.

Hey! He runs over to the interns. PAUL (cont‘d) What the hell are you doing? They ignore him. He looks at the Dean and runs over to hi PAUL (cont'd) You can’t just seize every copy here! The Dean stares at him harshly.
You‘re the one that wrote this misconstrued, sensationalistic piece of rubbish, didn’t you?
Sure did.
Let me tell you something young man, as far as I’m concerned, the only lunatic on this campus is you.
I'm...flattered. He takes out his tape recorder. (CONTINUED)
PAUL (cont'd) May I quote you on that? The Dean rolls his eyes and walks away. Reese steps up to the recorder.

I have a comment. U.S. News & World Report named Pendelton the safest university in the country. I call it the safest university in the Western Hemisphere and I intend to keep it that way with or without your help. She turns around and follows the Dean.
Thank you Reese. He turns to Natalie and Brenda. PAUL (cont'd) Well I guess I’m on the administration hit list again.
(to Brenda) Let’s get out of here. Paul turns to Natalie and Brenda and holds up his recorde
Wait! how about some interviews? Students reacts to tragedy on campus.
{forcing it; into recorder) Today, I am deeply saddened and moved by the sudden death --
Come on. Natalie grabs Brenda and drags her away.
See ya. . (she turns to Natalie) Tell me you noticed him licking his lips when he looked at me.
Major lickage. (CONTINUED)
Yes. Brenda jerks her arms back victoriously.
We pull back from the television where a NEWSMAN is discussing the murder.
...The police are still searching for the proprietor of the gas station. Brenda, Natalie, Damon, Parker and Sasha are sitting arou Parker has his arm around Sasha. Natalie is staring off i space.
(moved) Someone told me her radio was tuned to my show when it happened. My voice was probably the last thing she heard. Can you imagine?
Yeah, one minute you’ve finally figured out where your g-spot is, the next your head is too far away to see it. He starts laughing.
Hysterical, dumb ass.
What if there is a lunatic on campus?
Fine with me, I’m hitting the slopes this weekend. .
I heard the girl’s body kept driving by itself even though it had no head.
(sarcastic) Yeah, avd it pulled into a Taco Bell drive-tnrough for dinner. The group laughs. (CONTINUED)
Anyone here know her? Everyone shakes their heads, “no.” Natalie isn’t even listening. Brenda snaps her fingers in front of her face. BRENDA (cont'd) Hello...space cadet.
No, I didn’t know her.
Hey, I heard the dead girl gave good head. Get it? He grabs his head and pulls it back and forth. DAMON (cont'd)

Everyone laughs except for Natalie. EXT. NATALIE’S DORM - DUSK. 26 A faint orange glow lingers on the residence hall as the disappears. Students are heading back to their rooms. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 27 Natalie walks in. Heavy industrial music is BLASTING. Tos decked out in black, is sitting at her desk, typing on th computer and chain-smoking.
Hey Tosh. Sorry about last night. Tosh looks at her nastily.
Yeah well, don’t let it happen again. Natalie puts down her things. She notices a spilled bottl of pills on the floor. She kneels and picks it up. It’sa bottle of “Prozac.”
I think these are yours. Natalie tosses it to Tosh who swallows one of the pills. Natalie picks up the phone. We hear the staticky HISS of computer modem. Tosh is online. (CONTINUED)
Excuse me? Tosh?
(annoyed) What?
I need to check my voice-mail. Do you mind getting off-line for a minute?

(angry) Okay, but this is my phone line too... She turns off the computer. We hear the familiar America Online “Goodbye.” She storms out of the place. Natalie holds back her anger and shuts off the grating music. She dials the voice mail and puts the phone on speaker.

Hey it’s Brenda. Cardio funk hip-hop aerobics tonight? Call me. Natalie looks at herself in the mirror. Hanging off the s of it is a blue and gold tassel like Michelle Mancini had the car. Natalie looks away. She takes her coat off and goes to the closet to hang it. The answering machine BEEP

Natalie...I heard. Everyone's talking about it around town. What is going on up there? You better be carrying the Shrieker with you at all times. ALL TIMES. Natalie smiles to herself. She stops and kneels, picking packet up from the bottom of the closet. On it is a very 80's looking picture of a heavily made up girl being attacked, and holding up “The Shrieker” screaming device. She takes the device out of the box and sticks it in her pocket.

Better yet, maybe you should pack a bag and come home for the weekend. Call me. The machine BEEPS. As she’s about to close the closet doo she looks up at the top shelf and sees her old high schoo yearbook. She stares at it for a moment, then takes it ou She walks over to her desk, sits, and opens it up.

A picture of the cheerleading squad. We see Michelle Manc and Natalie standing right next to each other. She turns the page. Candid shots. One of them is Natalie and’Michelle, eating ice cream, their boyfriends behind t CLOSE ON Natalie’s face. She’s in tears. There’s a knock the door. Damon.
Hey! I was just in the neighborhood. Thought I’d pop by and see if you want to go hang out at the house. Parker’s gonna pierce Hootie’s nose.
Hootie’s a dog.
No reason he can’t be hip.
That’s okay Damon. He notices the tears in her eyes.
What's going on? You all right?
Yeah, I’m fine.
You sure? Listen, we don’t have to go hang out with a bunch of drunk frat guys...we can go somewhere and just talk.
(not sure) Um... He grabs her shoulder.
I'm a great listener you know. Natalie looks at him. Maybe he’s not such a slimeball aft all. INT. DAMON’ S CAR - NIGHT. 28 Damon jumps in. He offers her a beer.
Want a little something to warm you up?
Sure. He hands her a beer and tries to start the car...it doesn
Slight process. He moves the steering wheel around, pumps the gas and the engine ROARS.

There we go. He drives off. EXT. LAKESIDE - NIGHT. » 29 A small lake in the wooded area separating the campus fro the town. On the other side, we can see school buildings. full moon shines ominously, illuminating the water. We se sports car parked under a tree near the edge of the lake.
A few beer bottles are strewn on the floor.
So you and Michelle were like best friends? Natalie nods. DAMON (cont ‘d) So why haven't you spoken to each other in two years? Natalie stares at him.
I'd kinda prefer not to talk about it anymore.
You don’t wanna open up. Completely understandable. But I gotta tell ya...I know exactly what you're going through.
You do? (CONTINUED)
(sounding meaningful) Sure. I lost someone close to me once. My girlfriend. She...died. He covers his face with his hands. Natalie puts her arm around him.
I'm so sorry.

It's okay. She was sick for awhile...had a (reaching)...syndrome. I was afraid to get close to anybody again after that. And then, one day, it hit me. Why am I being so selfish? I have so much love inside of me to give.
(figuring out his game) You do? DAMON (cont'd) MmmHmmm. And Natalie...you're in need of loving.
I am?
Yup. You’re lonely. Repressed. Aching to break loose. Kinda things only a man can fix.
And I suppose you're this man?
You know: it. Damon stares at her then tries to kiss her. She pushes hi off. . NATALIE (cont'd) What the hell are you doing?
Don’t be afraid to love Natalie. You don’t have to be afraid anymore. He tries to kiss her again, a little more forcefully. She swings and punches him in the face. (CONTINUED)
DAMON (cont'd) Ouch!
Drive me home Damon.
Fuck, I’m just tryin’ to help you out. You don‘t have to act like such a freakin’ bitch.
You asshole. Just start the car.
You sure you don’t want to think about this? I’m all about healing Natalie.
One black eye or two Damon, you decide. Start the car.
(pissed) Hold on. I gotta take a leak. He steps outside.
(to herself) Pig. She doesn’t look well. She opens up the vanity mirror.

She stares at herself for a second. As she goes to close mirror, we catch a quick, unclear reflection of something outside. Natalie doesn’t notice. She’s waiting, looking impatient. Finally, she opens her door and steps out.

Damon, hurry up and let’s go. She walks backwards looking around. As she reaches the ba of the car, she turns to look forward and comes face to f with... THE KILLER. His hood is tight around his face making it impossible to make out who it is. Natalie GASPS. She star backing away, fumbling in her pocket. She pulls out the (CONTINUED)
“shrieker.” It SHRIEKS for barely a second before it’s ju hissing air. She throws it at him and runs into the car.

She locks the doors. Turns around. The back window is ope As she reaches back to shut it, a GLOVED HAND grabs her h from outside and starts reaching inside, trying to unlock door. Natalie grabs the keys from the ignition and stabs his ha The killer falls back and Natalie is able to shut the win NATALIE (cont'd)

She HONKS the horn, then: BOOM! From above. She stops honking. BOOM! She looks up. The roof of the car is denting...someone's walking on it. She tries starting the car. It won't. BOOM! A dent right above her head. Natalie reclines the seat back. She’s shaking. She stares up at the roof. It’s silent. Then, we begin to hear a low, steady sound. It’s getting louder and louder. SCRATCHING. Natalie is dumbfounded. It’s furious now. Like he’s trying to scratc his way inside the car. She jumps up and again tries the car. As we hear the engine choking, we PAN UP.

We see bare feet furiously scratching the roof. Then as w go up further we realize it’s Damon. He’s hung by a rope. keeps himself from being choked by holding onto his neck. can barely get his words out...
(breathlessly) Don’t start the car! Don’t start the car!

Natalie is still feverishly attempting to get the car started. The SCRATCHING even more furious than before. Natalie stops to catch her breath. She looks out the wind Presses her face against the glass, attempting to see wha happening on the roof, when suddenly... THE KILLER'S HEAD pops down from over the car, right in f of her,
(CONTINUED)
Natalie jumps back into her seat, adrenaline rushing, and suddenly remembers the trick to starting the car. She mov the steering wheel, pumps the gas, tries the ignition...T ENGINE ROARS.
Damon's face is aghast.

The car zooms away. We hear Damon's neck CRACK as his eye go blank and he’s pulled up towards the tree. We now see that the end of the rope is tied to the back of his car. INT. DAMON’S CAR - NIGHT. 36 Natalie SCREAMS as the KILLER lands on the front hood of car. He’s holding on to the windshield wipers. She jerks the car to throw him off. Suddenly, the car won’t move an further.
We see the tensed up rope not allowing the car to go forw
Natalie is shaking as The killer lurches up towards the windshield.
We see the RPM’s going into the red as Natalie hits the accelerator as far as it can go.
The killer’s moved up to the windshield. He starts kickin it in with his boots. The glass is CRACKING. Natalie looks down at the gear shift, slams it into rever She stares straight at the killer.
Fuck you. She hits the accelerator. The killer goes flying off the car.  39 40 41 42 31.
The rope behind the car is slacking.
Damon's body quickly starts to fall.
Natalie, out of breath, is looking back and doesn’t notic DAMON’S BODY through the windshield, falling straight towards her.
Damon's body CRASHES through the windshield landing right top of Natalie. NATALIE (cont ‘d)
The car stops moving. Glass covers the front. Natalie tri pushing Damon off, but he’s heavy. She manages to get out from under him and open the door.
She falls out of the car and looks around. No sign of the killer. She gets up and runs away.

On the wall hangs a large “Foxy Brown” poster with Pam Gr We hear a couple arguing 0.S. We track to a desk where Re is watching “Coffy,” another Pam Grier classic. Reese kno every line and delivers it with as much vigor as Pam.

This is the end of your rotten life you motherfuckin’ dope pusher! A shotgun BLAST followed by typical blaxploitation MUSIC. Reese holds up her small, standard issue gun and pretends shoot. . REESE (cont‘d) It was easy for him because he really didn’t believe it was coming, but it ain’t gonna be easy for you, ‘cause you better believe that it’s coming. (CONTINUED)

Suddenly there's loud BANGING on the door. Reese rolls he eyes at the interruption...her favorite scene. She opens door. Natalie is standing in front of her, distraught and shaking. REESE (cont'd) Girl what is wrong with you?
(hysterical) They killed him! Somebody killed him! Reese stares at her.
Reese is driving in the woods as Natalie sits, shaking. Reese caresses her shoulder.
Honey, everything's gonna be all right now. You hear me?
Turn here.
Reese turns off the main road into a dirt path.
Natalie turns to Reese. NATALIE (cont'd) Up ahead. She closes her eyes. Reese stops the car.
Here? Natalie looks up.
THERE’S NOTHING THERE. She steps out.
She walks around. It’s the same spot. Reese climbs out. (CONTINUED)
(stammering) I-I don’t get it...
If you don’t mind me asking...WHAT THE
Nothing! We were parked right here. Reese kneels down and picks up an empty beer bottle.
Right here, huh?
Reese, I’m not crazy. I know what I saw. It’s probably the same person who killed Michelle Mancini!
That's impossible. The police arrested the gas station attendant this evening. Natalie is speechless.
Brenda, Paul, Sasha and Parker are sitting around Natalie hasn't slept all night and looks it. Parker’s trying to h back his laughter.
Shut up.
Sorry. It’s just that, you've been had Natalie.
(pissed) He was dead when he crashed through the windshield Parker, this is no joke.
Trust me, he’s my frat brother and the best practical joker on campus. He once convinced a freshman he was the middle Hanson brother just so he could get laid.
So where is he? (CONTINUED)
Parker pulls out a paper with a phone number and the head ~ “Blair Mountain Ski Resort.”
Weekend ski trip with his buddies from back home.
Then where’s his car?
He drove. A realization comes over Parker. PARKER (cont‘d) Scratching on the roof of the car...don’t you get it? It’s just like the urban legend.
What urban legend?
Wexler talks about it every semester. Guy —~ and girl. Parked in the woods making out. Guy steps out. Girl hears spooky ~ scratching noises on the roof...it’s her dead boyfriend, hung from the tree.
And he was murdered. Remember? Brenda is breathing heavily now.
I'm starting to feel an anxiety attack coming on.
Calm down. He puts his hand on her knee. She looks at the hand then winks at Natalie.
Wait a second. That totally happened to my sister’s ex-boyfriend's cousin. Except he was hung from his feet and scratching with his nails. (CONTINUED)
It’s a variation babe. There's dozens of them. Thus the windshield stunt. (to Natalie) Tell me, what was this killer wearing?
A black parka.

With a furry hood? Natalie nods. Parker laughs. PARKER (cont’‘d) His Nanook of the North spook outfit. Look, Damon’s in the class. He knew the myth. He must've planned the whole thing out. Conniving bastard. Something hits Natalie.
Wait a second. There’s an urban legend 7 about a lunatic with an ax hiding ina woman's backseat.
Hello, my mom still checks the backseat before getting into a car.

That’s how Michelle Mancini died. Everyone stops arid stares at her. NATALIE (cont'd) It's almost like someone out there is taking these folk tales, our urban legends...and making them reality. Everyone is silent. Finally, the group bursts into uncontrollable LAUGHTER. Natalie looks angry.
Who knew Ms. Skepticism herself would envision such a daring concept. Parker turns to Natalie.
Call Damon. You’ll see. (CONTINUED)
Natalie stares hard at it. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - DAY. 48 Natalie walks in. Tosh is online again. She looks like sh hasn't stepped out of the room in days.
Tosh, do you mind if I -- Tosh turns around.
What?

Nevermind. She walks out. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN, we see that Tosh is in an America Online chat room called "Goth 4 Goth.” Her screen name is Forlorn22. She types, “Gothic guys on campus lookin’ to h up...IM me.” She takes a long drag off her cigarette and waits for a response.
Natalie is on a payphone outside.
That group is in one of our phone-free cabins.
Did they check in?
Oh, sure they did.
I need to know if a specific guest, Damon Brooks, is in that group.
(typing) Well...the cabin is not registered under his name and we really have no way of knowing exactly who’s in there. (CONTINUED)
Can I leave a message at the front desk?
Sure you can...but I can’t guarantee that they'll stop by to pick it up. Natalie looks defeated as she hangs up the phone.
A tall, brownstone structure towering over the campus.
Dark and musty with no windows. Half the bulbs are burnt out, darkening some of the aisles more than others. Natal slowly walks through the maze of bookstacks, searching th stacks.

A SHADOW moves in the distance. Natalie spins around. Did she see something? Just her imagination. She gets back to scanning. Suddenly we hear distinct FOOTSTEPS. Natalie stops in her tracks and looks around. The air is heavy wi dust.

Hello? No answer. She looks up one end of the narrow aisle then other. We hear the THUD of a book drop. It could be anywhere. NATALIE (cont ‘d) Is there someone there? Silence. She turns around. Directly in front of her is th book she’s been searching for, “Encyclopedia of Urban Legends.” It’s a heavy volume. She grabs it with both han and pulls it out revealing... EYES, staring right at her. Natalie SCREAMS and jumps bac against the shelves, knocking some books down.
Don’t freak out on me. Sasha walks around and over to Natalie. She’s holding an old, worn book. (CONTINUED)
SASHA (cont'd) I've been looking for this everywhere. An early printing of the “Kama Sutra”... with illustrations. You think Parker will get into it?
Does your sexual guinea pig have a choice?
No. {A Pause) What's that? Natalie hesitantly shows it to her. SASHA (cont'd) Encyclopedia of Urban Legends. Oh Natalie, don’t tell me you still think--
I don’t know Sasha.
Well let's take a look.
Natalie and Sasha are sitting down going over the urban legends book. Some of the pages are illustrated. Natalie turns to “The Boyfriend’s Death.” It resembles how Damon killed.
This is it. Sasha grabs the book and looks.
Hmm. Scary. She flips a page. SASHA (cont'd) Wait a second, this is definitely not an urban legend.
What? (CONTINUED)

The gang high-beam initiation. Happens all the time. Gang members drive around at night with their headlights off at and when someone flashes their high beams to warn them, they kill ‘em. So gruesome. Natalie snatches the book from her hand. SASHA (cont'd) That's why I never warn anyone about anything when I drive. Natalie stares heavily at the book. SASHA (cont‘d) Hello? Are you listening to me? Anyway, I'm going. Gotta get started practicing this. She holds up the Kama Sutra book.
Bye Sasha.

We see the illustration of the “Gang High-Beam Initiation CLOSE ON NATALIE’S EYES This story is obviously hitting a chord. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 53 Tosh is still waiting for a response. The ashtray on her desk is overflowing with cigarette butts. Suddenly we hea RING. There’s a message from a “Gloomy4U.” It reads, “We' on similar dark paths.” Tosh types, “What U into?” His response: “Lithium.” A smile cracks across her face. She types, “My type of gu with a little sideways happy face :)
Natalie is still looking over the book when, suddenly, th overhead lights start to blink. Natalie jumps. The LIBRAR ATTENDANT is standing at the doorway.
We’re closing in fifteen minutes, guys. (CONTINUED)

Natalie shuts the book. On the back is a paper with the names of the last few people to have checked it out. The most recent reads, “Damon Brooks.” She shakes her head...maybe it is some kind of sick joke. She gets up to leave. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 55 Tosh is getting excited. “Where u at?” She types. “Close. is his response. “Tease,” she types. “Gonna get ready. Let me know what room U R in.” She gets up, grabs her makeup bag and runs out of the roo

Natalie is walking back to her dorm on one of the cobbles walkways that zigzag through campus. There’s a few street lights scattered about. It’s desolate. She walks more hurriedly. A FIGURE suddenly appears from behind Natalie, sideswiping her. She jumps. It’s only a JOGGER.
Watch out!
(mumbling) Sorry.

Tosh is in front of the mirror, hurriedly applying makeup Smeared black mascara, black eyeliner, white face powder, etc. She runs back into the room. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 58 She sits at her desk again and looks at the computer scre She rereads her last message, “Tell me what room U R in.” Pan down to the response. “Yours.” Suddenly, THE KILLER appears behind her. He covers her mo with his gloved hand. We hear her muffled SCREAM as she struggles to break loos She tries typing “help” on the computer screen. The kille hits a button and shuts off the computer. Before it goes black, we hear the America Online “GOODBYE.” The killer rolls Tosh in her desk chair over to her bed. She tries t get up, but he knocks her down. He grabs her pillow and covers her face. Her screams sound like MOANING.  s9 60 61 41.
Natalie is walking into her residence hall, when a BITCHY GIRL walks out.
Hmm...sounds like Elvira’s raising more than the dead in there.

Thanks for the warning. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 60 Tosh is GASPING for air. We hear the sound of the KEY IN LOCK. THE KILLER grabs the lamp cord and unplugs it. It’s completely dark now. THE DOOR swings open.

Natalie is feeling for the light switch. She’s almost reached it when...she hears the MOANING. She opts against it. CLOSE ON TOSH. Her violent jerking can be mistaken for something else. Natalie lock the door once, then, after some thought, loc again. She makes her way through the room in the dark, accidently bumping into Tosh’s bed.
(whispering) Sorry. Not looking. Natalie climbs into bed, covering her ears with the pillo

The life goes out of her. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - MORNING. 61 Sunlight is pouring into the room. Natalie slowly wakes u She stretches her arms, opens her eyes. Her vision is groggy. She notices writing on the wall across from her. Her vision slowly starts to come into focus. She makes ou the word “Aren’t.” She’s dumbfounded. (CONTINUED)

Aren’t... There’s more. NATALIE (cont‘d) You...glad...you...didn’t...turn on the light? It's written in dripping blood. NATALIE (cont‘d) Tosh? She turns to her side and finds... a ghastly TOSH, her wrists slit, lying in bed staring straight at Natalie. NATALIE (cont’d)

Natalie is sitting down surrounded by Dean Adams, Reese a couple of COPS. The door is open and Natalie, eyes glazed is staring out at Tosh’s covered body being wheeled off b PARAMEDIC. The bitchy girl stands against the wall watching.
(to paramedic) You better check her pulse...she’s looked like that for years. Brenda appears at the door. She looks concerned and waves Natalie. Natalie waves back.
Natalie? She turns to him. DEAN ADAMS (cont'd) Some water? He hands her a glass of water and sits in. front. of her.
Thank you. (CONTINUED)
So you heard moaning when you walked in. Why didn't you turn on the lights?
I'd walked in on Tosh having sex before. It wasn’t something I cared to see again.
So you never actually saw anyone there?
No. The Dean and Reese look at one another.
Natalie did you know Tosh was manic- depressive? He holds up the bottle of Prozac.
She painted half the room black. I hada good idea.
There’s no signs of foul play here. No forced entry. No signs of a struggle. No witnesses.
What are you saying?
This appears to be a very tragic...suicide.
(disbelieving) Tosh did not kill herself. There was someone else in that room. “Aren’t you glad you didn’t turn on the lights” for Christ's sake!
A very morbid...suicide note. Dead silence. The Dean compassionately places his hand on Natalie's lap. (CONTINUED)

Look, I’m having someone come in right now and hold a counseling session with the rest of the dorm. It might be a good idea for you to sit in. Natalie stares at the Dean and Reese. We track behind her towards one of the computer terminals. On the screen is t America Online sign-off message. It reads, “Goodbye Gloomy4u.”
Brenda and Natalie are slowly walking up towards the dorm common area.
Natalie, maybe Tosh just couldn’t deal with life anymore.
Tosh could never deal with life...she just wouldn't kill herself. I don’t understand what’s happening Brenda.
Maybe this counselor isn’t such a bad idea.
Have you ever been in therapy?
Sure.
Did it help?
No. But it makes for great conversation at parties. . Brenda smiles and Natalie forces one out too. They reach entrance to the common room and pause.

A few students are gathered in a circle around ‘a late tw something counselor, DOUG. He's wearing a white turtle ne under a sweater and has a calm, involved look on his face Everyone else looks disinterested and bored. In the background we hear ENYA playing. (CONTINUED)

.-This is all about compassion, dialogue, mutual support -- All eyes turn to Natalie. He stops mid-sentence and looks back. A wave of sympathy and emotion rolls over him. DOUG (cont’d) You must be the roommate. Come here sweetheart. She slowly walks towards him. He speeds things up and gra her, hugging her tightly. He closes his eyes. DOUG (cont'd) Ooze it all out...right on me, don’t be afraid. CLOSE ON NATALIE'’S FACE This isn’t what she needs right now. Doug turns to Brenda DOUG (cont'd) Do you need to ooze too?
(waving hands) Oh no, I’m all oozed up. He grabs Natalie’s hand and sits her down. Brenda follows

Just sit right here. We’re discussing just what Tosh meant to each of us. Who has the talking stick? A WHOLESOME GIRL raises her hand, clutching onto a wooden stick. . DOUG (cont‘d) You go ahead angel.

(upset) Well...one time Tosh threatened to gouge my eyes out if I didn’t stop blasting my Amy Grant CD. I thought she was really mean...but now I know it was only a cry for help. She starts crying. He pats her back. (CONTINUED)
There, there. Which album?
(through tears) “Heart and Motion” He smiles sympathetically.
I really like that one. (a pause) Anyone else have anything to say about Tosh? THE GROUP could care less about Tosh. DOUG (cont’d) You? He grabs the talking stick and hands it to a PREPPY GUY.
Um. I didn’t know her.
It seems that way now...to all of us, doesn’t it? Like we never really knew the real Tosh. Such is the depth of the human soul.
No. I just didn’t know her. Never met her in my life. Doug angrily grabs the stick from his hand.
Anyone else? Natalie? He tries handing her the stick. DOUG (cont'd) You wanna grab the stick? Brenda looks to Natalie. All eyes are on her. This is too much to handle. .
I just wanna be alone right now. She stands up and walks out of the room. A BITTER GIRL tu to the group. (CONTINUED)
What's she so upset about...she’s the one getting a 4.0 this semester.
So...anyone up for a little role playing?
Natalie runs out of her dorm. She stops on the front step and catches her breath. She sits down and shuts her eyes, completely overwhelmed.
Hey. She looks up. Paul is standing in front of her, holding o his tape recorder.
Sorry Paul, I'm not doing any interviews. He sticks the recorder in his pocket and holds his hands
Strictly off the record.
I think I’m going crazy.
Happens to the best of us. He sits down next to her. PAUL (cont’d) Did you see it coming?
Yes -- no. I mean...I don’t know.
This suicide note I heard about.
Aren‘t you glad you didn’t turn on the light...in her blood. Paul looks away. Laughs.
That’s weird. When I was a kid, I heard a story about a college girl who's (MORE) (CONTINUED)
PAUL (cont'd) roommate was murdered. The roommate walked in that night and went straight to bed. The next morning -- Natalie turns to him. Something hits her.
An urban legend. Paul looks at her. NATALIE (cont’d) Paul, Tosh didn’t commit suicide. There was somebody else in there. It’s really happening. Something hits Paul.
Tonight’s the anniversary you know.
What anniversary?
The Stanley Hall massacre. If it really happened that is.
How do we find out for sure? We pull up behind them and see Brenda in the upstairs win staring on.

A small single in the frat house. The blinds are drawn an Indian sitar music is PLAYING in the background. Sasha, dressed in sexy lingerie, is lighting candles around the while Parker lies shirtless in bed, anxiously awaiting whatever she has planned.
So...what are we doin’?
It's a surprise.
Hootie, a Yorkshire Terrier with a nose ring, is sitting the floor, staring up at her. (CONTINUED)
And Hootie is out of here.
Oh come on! He’s not bothering you.
Parker, he makes me uncomfortable. She opens the door, about to let him out.
It’s all right boy. You'll be back ina few minutes.
I only wish it lasted that long. Parker sneers at her.
A college version of the bustling newsroom. Reporters pil on top of each other typing on old computers or talking o the phone. Paul and Natalie walk in.
We have an archive with every issue of the Pendelton Daily that’s ever been published. If there was a massacre on campus you can bet it’s in there.
So this is where you come up with your lurid articles. .
I don’t come up with them. They just happen. Only thing I do is spice them up, add a little intrigue...make ‘em better. Nothing wrong with that.
Well you’ve managed to convince yourself.
Only way to survive. Over there. He points to a wooden door.
68 SQ.
A dimly lit room lined with large stacks. Natalie and Pau are staring at an empty space in one of the shelves.
I can’t believe this. They’re gone.
They wouldn’t be anywhere else?
Nowhere I'd know of. They're startled by a CREAK. They turn and find the janit mopping up. PAUL (cont'd) Excuse me.
Yeah?
How long you been working at Pendelton?
Oh, started in ‘69, so almost thirty years now. Paul and Natalie look at each other.
Can you tell us what happened at Stanley Hall? . The janitor suddenly looks uncomfortable. He looks away.
I don’t know what you're talking about.
Did people die there?
I can’t help you with that.
Look, this is very important. We need to know if it’s true or not. This is clearly not something the janitor wants to discus (CONTINUED)
Talk to Professor Wexler.
Why?
He knows more than I do. But don’t tell anyone I said anything. He grabs his bucket and mop and walks out. Paul and Natal look at each other.
Paul and Natalie are storming out when, suddenly, Brenda appears in front of them.
Hey guys! What’s up? I was just passing by and --
(interrupting) Brenda, I’1l talk to you later. Paul completely ignores her as him and Natalie walk out.
(yelling out) I'll be at the gym! She hushes, looking none too pleased with herself.

Sasha and Parker, both nude, are completely entwined. The “Kama Sutra” book is propped up on the nightstand. Sasha writhing in ecstasy. Parker looks like he’s being crushed PARKER . Can’t we ever just do it like normal people?
(moaning) Parker, any expert will tell you the secret to long-lasting relationships is variety. (CONTINUED)
I’m just saying, it wouldn’t hurt to get into the missionary position every now and then.

We hear the faint sound of SCRATCHING. The door creaks op and Hootie walks in. He's GASPING. Having problems breathing. He walks over to the bed and jumps on. Parker turns and sees him. PARKER (cont'd) What's wrong? Hootie just stares at Parker, helplessly.
Sasha. Sasha...enough! Disengage. There’s something wrong with Hootie.

He's just getting excited watching us. Now come on. Hootie is now GASPING heavily. Sasha and Parker both look him when... He COUGHS. Suddenly, a BLOODY FINGER flies out of his mou landing on Sasha's breast. SASHA (cont‘d)
Paul is banging on Professor Wexler’s office door as Nata stands against the wall waiting.
He should be here...it’s his office _ hours.

I don’t think Wexler’s much into student/teacher interaction. He tries the door. It’s unlocked. Paul heads inside. He motions for her to follow. She hesitates and then goes ahead.  72 73 $3. INT. PROF. WEXLER’S OFFICE - DAY. 72 It’s small and cluttered. A window looks onto the quad. Paul is snooping around.
(nervous) What if he shows up? He ignores her and points to another door.
What do you think that leads to?

Paul we should go. He walks over and opens the door. A BLACK PARKA leaps out him. He jumps. It was hanging inside the door. They both laugh. He looks inside the closet and his smile quickly vanishes. PAUL (cont’d) Natalie... She walks over, looks inside and freezes.
Laying on the floor is AN AX. We hear FOOTSTEPS approachi and see A’ FIGURE’S outline in the door window. Paul pull her into the closet and closes the door. It doesn’t shut completely.

They’re pressed up against each other. They look heavily into each other’s eyes. Wexler is in the room. We hear FOOTSTEPS as he walks to his desk. We hear him SHUFFLING with some papers. The closet door is slowly CREAKING open. They stare at th expanding crack. The FOOTSTEPS outside seem to be heading out. The front door opens and shuts.
(whispering) Is he gone? Paul looks out the crack.
(CONTINUED)
No one there. He nods. He opens the door slowly and they walk out.
Paul closes the door behind him revealing... PROFESSOR WEXLER standing behind the door.
Lost something? They turn around and freeze.
No. He looks at them menacingly.

head_text.subj: THEN WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING INSIDE

text: Paul and Natalie run out.
An OVERWEIGHT GUY in a hurry dumps a soda cup on the gras
(over a P.A.) You might wanna pick that up. He stops and turns to find Reese in her security car, tal over the loudspeaker. He nervously goes back and picks up the cup.
Reese laughs to herself. Suddenly, Natalie and Paul burst through the doors of the nearby classroom building. She steps out of her car.
. Hey! What the hell?!?
Reese! It’s Wexler.
What? (CONTINUED)
The Dean is sitting behind his desk, staring daggers at P and Natalie. Reese sits behind them, listening.
(sympathetically) Now Natalie, I know you're dealing with a lot right now. Suicide --
Tosh was murdered! He closes his eyes and tenses up for a second then looks and smiles.
Why do you two insist on creating an unnecessary atmosphere of paranoia in my school? Hmm?
Tell us about Stanley Hall Dean. ~ Reese’s ears prick up.
It‘s a...what do you call it? An urban legend. You hear that on every college campus.
But it had to originate somewhere.
Was Wexler involved? The Dean is silent.
Natalie, maybe you'd care to sheda little light on something I noticed on your file.
What is that?
Your probation for reckless endangerment. No response from Natalie. Paul looks at her, eyebrow rais Ne (CONTINUED)
That was in high school.

I know. Happened after you’d already been accepted to Pendelton. You're lucky. The admissions office might have not looked upon a criminal record very favorably otherwise. Would you care to elaborate? Natalie looks at Paul then at the Dean.
No I wouldn't. That has nothing to do with what's happening.

Natalie there is nothing happening except two, completely unrelated tragedies. Now, I want to be as supportive as possible, but you’re skating on thin ice right now. So I’m requesting you take an academic leave of absence through the end of the semester. It'll do you some good to deal with what’s happening, back home, with your family.
So that’s it, that’s how you're going to handle this? By sending me away? The Dean is silent. Paul stands up.
Let's get out of here.
I’m not through yet. You‘re off the paper Paul. This institution's had enough of your inflammatory articles.
What? You can’t do this! There’s something in the constitution called freedom of speech!
The constitution doesn’t protect someone who wrongfully yells “fire” in a crowded theater. And Paul, you’ve yelled fire one too many times on this campus. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
DEAN ADAMS (cont'd) (a pause) Enjoy your weekend.
The sun is now completely obscured by storm clouds. Paul Natalie step out of the administration building. There's tense silence.

Reckless endangerment...we’re not exactly talking about running a stop sign here are we? No response from Natalie. PAUL (cont'd) Natalie, I just lost a lot in there following your lead. So, maybe I have a right to know a little about your past.
It‘s not something I wanna discuss.
You don’t wanna discuss it. Okay. Do you want to discuss my career options without a body of writing samples? Because FYI Natalie, they’re kind of limited. :
Paul, whatever happened, it doesn't change the fact that someone on this campus is killing people!
It doesn’t? I don’t know if I buy it anymore. Honestly, Natalie, I don’t know if I ever bought it.
(realizing) Just looking for the big story, huh?

You got it. But that’s over with. So...write a letter to the editor. He turns and walks away, leaving Natalie standing alone i the quad.  59. 80 INT. DEAN’S OFFICE - DAY. 80 The Dean is on the phone. Reese is waiting to speak to hi
(into phone) Oh yes, very, very well. Enrollment’s up this semester and we've got record admissions applications for next --
Dean Adams?

(covering phone; serious) Just a second. (into phone) Okay. No, all that’s been taken care of. Thank God. Miles outside of Pendelton. See you on Founder’s Day. Good-bye. He hangs up the phone. DEAN ADAMS (cont‘d) Yes?
I was just thinking it might not be a bad idea to add a few extra guards this weekend. In case --
